result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Carlos E Boyer was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess any firearms.  Absolute Sobriety.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carlos E Boyer in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  State states joint recommendations.  State notes victim contact their office yesterday stating she wanted to drop off the restitution claim.  State notes if the parties feel there is a need for a restitution hearing they would contact the court w/in 30 days.  Atty Masana is in agreement.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE re: felony fireams warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.

Ct 1:
Probation for 3 years
Conditions of probation:
6 months jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence (1st 48 hrs consecutive)
To commence on or before 3/4/2017 at 6:00 pm unless agent directs otherwise
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan w/Clerk's Office
Revoke DL 12 months
IID 12 months effective upon licensure
AODA (***DE to sign up today before leaving the courthouse***)
Absolute sobriety at all times
Treatment per agent
Not to possess any firearms
DNA sample to be provided
Restitution (if any) to be determined by stipulation or request for hearing w/in 30 days
Sentencing hearing on January 5, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Carlos E Boyer in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  PSI ordered.  To be completed no later than 12/27/2016.  Bond continued.
